thread.title: Ed Sheeran mega fan was 'forced to sell car and move house' after being 'fleeced' out of £1,300 for tickets
thread.title_full: Ed Sheeran mega fan was 'forced to sell car and move house' after being 'fleeced' out of £1,300 for tickets

author: Charlotte Dobson
title: Ed Sheeran mega fan was 'forced to sell car and move house' after being 'fleeced' out of £1,300 for tickets
text:
News Ed Sheeran mega fan was 'forced to sell car and move house' after being 'fleeced' out of £1,300 for tickets Devastated Charlotte, from Littleborough, Rochdale, thought she was paying £440 for all three tickets for her and friends Share Charlotte Duckworth and inset Ed Sheeran Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
An Ed Sheeran mega fan claims she is being forced to sell her car and move home after being ‘fleeced’ out of £1,300 for the star’s Manchester Arena gig. 
Charlotte Duckworth, 21, has blasted the ticketing website after being ‘ripped off’ for three tickets to Sheeran’s sold out arena gig in April. Read More Ed Sheeran fans are furious as tickets offered for up to £1,000 each... minutes after going on sale 
Devastated Charlotte, from Littleborough, Rochdale, thought she was paying £440 for all three tickets for her and friends on ticketing website Viagogo. 
It wasn’t until she received confirmation of her order that Charlotte realised she had been charged more than £1,300 for the tickets as well as booking fees. 
The young phone shop worker is now making desperate attempts to recoup the money - and has even made a direct appeal for help from Sheeran himself. (Photo: handout) 
Charlotte claims she may now have to move back to her parents’ house and sell her car to pay off her huge credit card bill. 
The heartbroken fan told the MEN: “After a horrible year last year all I wanted was to start this year off with a bang and see my idol. Instead I’m now in £1329.41 worth of debt. Read More Metrolink driver gets blurred vision after yobs shine LASER in his eyes 
“I was rushing to buy the tickets because when your putting your details in lots of pop ups come on the screen saying there’s 20 people waiting for these tickets. You’re also being timed. 
“I thought I had paid £377 for all three tickets. Turns out that was per ticket as well as a large booking fee. 
“It was only later when I realised that I had been charged £1547 on the credit card. I have tried everything to get my money back from Viagogo but they have refused and I feel like I have been misled into buying over priced tickets. I had never heard of Viagogo before and didn’t realise they could do this.” 
Charlotte claims she thought she was buying the tickets directly off Ed Sheeran’s official site. This turned out not to be the case. Read More Do noisy eaters throw you into a rage? This could be the scientific reason why... 
She said she has tried to stop the transaction going through by contacting the credit card company but bosses said there was nothing they could do. 
The young music fan is now urging other people of so-called touting sites and the huge mark ups on tickets. 
She added: “This has caused me severe financial problems and I may have to move back home or sell my car to cover the costs, as i haven’t got that kind of money. 
“I really want to spread the word so others don’t make this mistake and end up in a mess like myself. 
“Viagogo are a very misleading overpriced website that people need to stay away from.” 
Viagogo have been contacted for comment. Like us on Facebook
